messages.message:
In account settings, *Enable* should not be part of option names. Disable/enable is implied by the toggle. This is specified in our UI text guidelines (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DOCS/pages/2104492033/UI+text+guidelines#Switches-(toggles),-toggle-chips,-and-single-checkboxes).

We should also consider grouping options by app, so we don't have to specify app name in the option. See recommendations below.

I also have technical questions about existing options:
1. What's up with the validations in Build option? Validations seem to work without enabling this toggle, so do we actually need it? And why is it grouped with UDFs in refinement?
2. What is "map-reduce extraction pipeline"? We should be clearer about what this means.
*Features*
(o ) Dark mode

*Converse* #subhead
(o ) Multi-doc conversations

*Build* #subhead
(o ) Validations
(o ) Custom functions in refinements
(o ) Map-reduce extraction pipeline

NM! Lydia informs me that Dark mode is the only option visible to external users.

I'm leaving this here just in case we need a template for more external options in future.

Just adding some context - these feature flag controls are only visible to internal users for internal-opt-in features, external users will not see this.
The flags are populated dynamically from the flag list, and I don't think we have the group/app information in the list. So adding the groups will not be straightforward.
